headline: Editor & Lifestyle Media Correspondent of MimiCuteLipsÂ®
summary: Michellette has over 20 years of professional administrative experience; interpersonal skills and the ability to interact and work with staff at all levels. She utilizes tact, diplomacy and professional judgment. She has excellent written and oral communication skills coupled with exceptional organizational skills and the ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment. Michellette has the willingness to take initiative and follow through on projects.

defaultPosition.description:
Michellette "Mimi" Green is the Lifestyle Media Correspondent and editor behind MimiCuteLips.  MimiCuteLips is a lifestyle blog for women of all shapes, sizes, colors, and walks of life.  MimiCuteLips uses blog posts, videos and events to show women they can have the life they desire while wearing multiple hats.

You can find Mimi working media at your favorite events, traveling and trying out new adventures, or working on a dope DIY project.  Either way, she is going to share the experience with you.  Mimi has covered media events at the White House, Essence Festival, New York Fashion Week and more. Her proudest media accomplishment to date is interviewing Denzel Washington.

She has been featured on Fox 5 DC, WBALTV 11, Huff Post Live, Fox 45, ABC 7, News Channel 8 and Sisters 2 Sister magazine.

â¢	Create original SEO optimized content geared toward women.
â¢	Provide social media management for live events.
â¢	Cover red carpet events and interview talent.
â¢	Leverage social media to build a community of 10,000 followers and subscribers.
â¢	Collaborate with brands on marketing campaigns.
â¢	Produce engaging photos and video content
â¢	TV/Radio media appearances
â¢	I am currently a Brand Ambassador for St. Jude Childrenâs Research Hospital

positions.title: Blogger/Media Correspondent/ Event Host/Emcee

positions.description:
- Manage purchases for the division, reconcile transactions and close out errors and discrepancies by their deadline.

- Provide all timekeeping related assistance. This includes constant pass-code resets, guidance, changing of funding codes, and processing time cards and errors during the first day or furlough and upon our return to ensure all staff is paid on time.

- Maintain gym membership monthly, reporting on time and adding and removing members as needed. This also includes assisting with any issues regarding visits to the gym.

- Serve as the lead Emergency Occupant this includes maintaining my AED defibrillator and CPR training. 

- Mange task and data calls which are Congressional, DHS, ICE, and OCIO inquires. 

- Process the on-boarding/exiting of employees.

- Tracking Training requirements for staff

- Maintain division accuracy and accountability for all government furnished equipment.

- Performance Work Plan standardization and facilitation bi-annually. Simultaneously closing out the past year and implementing the current year at the start of a new fiscal year. 

- Provide Executive functions and Office Management to the Division Director such as a variety of activities and special assignments, related to the missions and functions of the OCIO and serve as the principal point of contact for Senior OCIO managers and staff on all administrative items, personnel issues and procedures.

- Develop, streamline and/or organize administrative personnel programs, policies of new plans, schedules and methods to accommodate changing program requirements of Administrative Policies and procedures

- Coordinate/create travel and conferences, authorizations, vouchers, expense reports, and preparing itineraries for management.
positions.title: Management Program Analyst

positions.description:
- Administrative support of several Hoover Fellows to include document preparation, research, meeting set up, and catering.

- Work with vendors and contractors on a 1.7 million suite renovation

- Set up and assist with Task Force meetings

- Assist with Accounts payable & receivable on a monthly basis.

- Order office supplies for general office and special request for executives.

- Implemented filing systems, organized contacts, and created policies and procedures.
positions.title: Administrative Associate

positions.description:
- Provide leadership support, problem solving and administrative guidance for committees as necessary 

- Coordinate meetings providing travel and accommodation arrangements, meeting communiquÃ©s and materials, ordering supplies, composing, editing, formatting documents and presentations.

- Coordinate conference calls for clients throughout the world.

- Develop and maintain various databases dealing with incoming and outgoing correspondence.

- Process registrations for various meetings while maintaining accurate attendance to ensure that all guests are appropriately accommodated.

- Sole support to the Vice President of Industry Relations

- Travel to and coordinate onsite meeting, conference, and hotel registration with functions including but not limited to: meeting and greeting of members and attendees, payment collection, event set-up, and the gathering and producing of meeting material

- Maintain and updated company web page regularly using HTML and graphic techniques.

- Utilized Adobe Photoshop, Indesign & Illustrator advanced desktop publishing to a create membership pamphlet, bulletins, meeting media-type advertisements and other communication artifacts.

- Maintained statistical data as it relates to meeting attendance, sponsorship, and exhibitors.
positions.title: Program Coordinator - Industry Relationation
